title: Congratulations! Country music lovebirds Carly Pearce and Michael Ray tied the knot
text:
CLOSE

Carly Pearce and Michael Ray got married over the weekend. (Photo: George Walker IV / Tennessean.co)

Congratulations are in order for Carly Pearce and her new husband Michael Ray — the two got married over the weekend.

Country music's it couple had their wedding ceremony on Sunday in Nashville, almost a month after announcing they got a marriage license, Pearce's rep Erin Burr confirmed to USA TODAY.

“Knowing without a shadow of a doubt that I didn’t settle for something less than truly the person that I think was made for me is something that I am thankful for,” Pearce told the People magazine after their big day.

More: Michael Ray, Carly Pearce team with Bumble to plan date night

According to People, the couple's wedding was intimate with only 100 of their family members and friends. It was officiated by country music DJ Bill Cody, who serves as the announcer at the Grand Ole Opry.

Ray shared a photo on Sunday of his new wife sitting on his lap, wearing a huge grin and captioned it "You..." with a heart emoji. While his post was filled with congratulatory messages from fans, Pearce simply commented with a bride emoji.

The country duo started dating in summer 2018. Pearce had known fellow country singer Ray for years before she started playing shows with him. They were cordial, she said, but never close. She was surprised when she felt inexplicably drawn to him. Pearce was dating someone else and quickly ended the relationship.

“I said to one of my very good girlfriends that even if I don’t ever date Michael Ray, I cannot be in this relationship and have these kinds of feelings for someone else,” she said.

Ahead of the wedding, Pearce shared a photo to Instagram of the happy couple drinking a glass of red wine and holding their marriage certificate up for all to see.

"Found out today getting your marriage license & buying a good bottle of Cabernet costs about the same," the "Every Little Thing" artist captioned the post and added a bride and groom emoji with the hashtag #COUNTDOWNISON.

Contributing Cindy Watts

description: The country duo, Carly Pearce and Michael Ray, are married. They started dating in summer 2018, before announcing their engagement in December.
